oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Marquis de Lafayette
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One of twenty-eight artist's sketches of mural figures for Sevier State Office Building, Nashville. This drawing shows the General John Sevier (1745-1815), in uniform holding a raised sword in one hand and his hat in the other.

The mural was installed in 1941 its artist, Dean Cornwell (1892-1960), also created murals for the Los Angeles Public Library, the Raleigh Room at the Hotel Warwick in NYC, and the Davidson County Courthouse.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sevier, John, 1745-1815;Cornwell, Dean, 1892-1960
